intro: Crataegus ravenelii, commonly known as Ravenel’s hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 6 to 15 feet and features thorny branches with oval, dark green leaves that turn red or orange in the fall. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers in the spring, followed by red, juicy berries that are an important food source for birds and wildlife. Its botanical characteristics include simple, alternate leaves and a preference for well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
